summary: Hardrock minerals (e.g., gold and silver) play a significant role in U.S. and global economies. In 2018, hardrock minerals extracted worldwide were valued at about $981 billion. We reviewed how some foreign countries, U.S. states, and tribal governments manage hardrock mining. We found that the selected jurisdictions primarily use leasing to explore for minerals, develop new mines, extract minerals, and reclaim mined lands. These jurisdictions...
title: Hardrock Mining Management: Selected Countries, U.S. States, and Tribes Have Different Governance Structures but Primarily Use Leasing
